<s> Filmography Film Television Theatre Du Fu Du Fu Wade Giles Tu Fu Chinese unk unk was a prominent Chinese poet of the Tang dynasty </s>
<s> Along with Li unk Li Po he is frequently called the greatest of the Chinese poets </s>
<s> His greatest ambition was to serve his country as a successful civil servant but he proved unable to make the necessary accommodations </s>
<s> His life like the whole country was devastated by the An unk Rebellion of unk and his last years were a time of almost constant unrest </s>
<s> Although initially he was little known to other writers his works came to be hugely influential in both Chinese and Japanese literary culture </s>
<s> Of his poetic writing nearly fifteen hundred poems have been preserved over the ages </s>
<s> He has been called the Poet Historian and the Poet Sage by Chinese critics while the range of his work has allowed him to be introduced to Western readers as the Chinese Virgil Horace unk Shakespeare Milton Burns unk unk Hugo or unk </s>
<s> Life Traditional Chinese literary criticism emphasized the life of the author when interpreting a work a practice which Burton Watson attributes to the close links that traditional Chinese thought posits between art and morality </s>
<s> Since many of Du Fu s poems feature morality and history this practice is particularly important </s>
<s> Another reason identified by the Chinese historian William unk is that Chinese poems are typically unk unk context that might be relevant but which an informed contemporary could be assumed to know </s>
<s> For modern Western readers The less accurately we know the time the place and the circumstances in the background the more liable we are to imagine it incorrectly and the result will be that we either unk the poem or fail to understand it altogether </s>
<s> Stephen Owen suggests a third factor particular to Du Fu arguing that the variety of the poet s work required consideration of his whole life rather than the unk unk used for more limited poets </s>
<s> Early years Most of what is known of Du Fu s life comes from his poems </s>
<s> His paternal grandfather was Du unk a noted politician and poet during the reign of Empress Wu </s>
<s> Du Fu was born in unk the exact birthplace is unknown except that it was near Luoyang Henan province Gong county is a favourite candidate </s>
<s> In later life he considered himself to belong to the capital city of Chang an ancestral hometown of the Du family </s>
<s> Du Fu s mother died shortly after he was born and he was partially raised by his aunt </s>
<s> He had an elder brother who died young </s>
<s> He also had three half brothers and one half sister to whom he frequently refers in his poems although he never mentions his stepmother </s>
<s> The son of a minor scholar official his youth was spent on the standard education of a future civil servant study and unk of the Confucian classics of philosophy history and poetry </s>
<s> He later claimed to have produced unk poems by his early teens but these have been lost </s>
<s> In the early unk he travelled in the unk Zhejiang area his earliest surviving poem describing a poetry contest is thought to date from the end of this period around </s>
<s> In that year he took the civil service exam likely in Chang an </s>
<s> He failed to his surprise and that of centuries of later critics </s>
<s> unk concludes that he probably failed because his prose style at the time was too dense and obscure while Chou suggests his failure to unk connections in the capital may have been to blame </s>
<s> After this failure he went back to traveling this time around Shandong and Hebei </s>
<s> His father died around </s>
<s> Du Fu would have been allowed to enter the civil service because of his father s rank but he is thought to have given up the privilege in favour of one of his half brothers </s>
<s> He spent the next four years living in the Luoyang area fulfilling his duties in domestic affairs </s>
<s> In the autumn of unk he met Li unk Li Po for the first time and the two poets formed a friendship </s>
<s> David Young describes this as the most significant formative element in Du Fu s artistic development because it gave him a living example of the reclusive poet scholar life to which he was attracted after his failure in the civil service exam </s>
<s> The relationship was somewhat one sided however </s>
<s> Du Fu was by some years the younger while Li unk was already a poetic star </s>
<s> We have twelve poems to or about Li unk from the younger poet but only one in the other direction </s>
<s> They met again only once in unk </s>
<s> In he moved to the capital in an attempt to resurrect his official career </s>
<s> He took the civil service exam a second time during the following year but all the candidates were failed by the prime minister apparently in order to prevent the emergence of possible rivals </s>
<s> He never again attempted the examinations instead unk the emperor directly in unk and probably again in unk </s>
<s> He married around unk and by unk the couple had had five children three sons and two daughters but one of the sons died in infancy in unk </s>
<s> From he began to have lung problems probably asthma the first of a series of unk which unk him for the rest of his life </s>
<s> It was in that year that Du Fu was forced to move his family due to the turmoil of a famine brought about by massive floods in the region </s>
<s> In unk he received an appointment as unk of the Right Commandant s office of the Crown Prince s Palace </s>
<s> Although this was a minor post in normal times it would have been at least the start of an official career </s>
<s> Even before he had begun work however the position was swept away by events </s>
<s> War The An unk Rebellion began in December unk and was not completely suppressed for almost eight years </s>
<s> It caused enormous disruption to Chinese society the census of recorded </s>
<s> million people but ten years later the census counted just </s>
<s> million the remainder having been displaced or killed </s>
<s> During this time Du Fu led a largely itinerant life unk by wars associated unk and imperial unk </s>
<s> This period of unk was the making of Du Fu as a poet Even Shan Chou has written that What he saw around him the lives of his family neighbors and strangers what he heard and what he hoped for or feared from the progress of various campaigns these became the enduring themes of his poetry </s>
<s> Even when he learned of the death of his youngest child he turned to the suffering of others in his poetry instead of dwelling upon his own unk </s>
<s> Du Fu wrote unk on what I have lived through if even I know such suffering the common man must surely be unk by the winds </s>
<s> In unk Emperor unk was forced to flee the capital and unk </s>
<s> Du Fu who had been away from the city took his family to a place of safety and attempted to join the court of the new emperor unk but he was captured by the rebels and taken to Chang an </s>
<s> In the autumn his youngest son Du unk Baby Bear was born </s>
<s> Around this time Du Fu is thought to have contracted malaria </s>
<s> He escaped from Chang an the following year and was appointed unk when he rejoined the court in May unk </s>
<s> This post gave access to the emperor but was largely ceremonial </s>
<s> Du Fu s unk compelled him to try to make use of it he caused trouble for himself by protesting the removal of his friend and patron Fang Guan on a petty charge </s>
<s> He was arrested but was unk in June </s>
<s> He was granted leave to visit his family in September but he soon rejoined the court and on December unk he returned to Chang an with the emperor following its recapture by government forces </s>
<s> However his advice continued to be unk and in the summer of unk he was demoted to a post as Commissioner of Education in unk </s>
<s> The position was not to his taste in one poem he wrote I am about to scream unk in the office Especially when they bring more papers to pile higher on my desk </s>
<s> He moved on in the summer of unk this has traditionally been ascribed to famine but unk believes that frustration is a more likely reason </s>
<s> He next spent around six weeks in unk now unk Gansu province where he wrote more than sixty poems </s>
<s> unk In December unk he briefly stayed in unk modern Gansu </s>
<s> He departed on December for unk Sichuan province where he was hosted by local unk and fellow poet unk Di </s>
<s> Du subsequently based himself in Sichuan for most of the next five years </s>
<s> By the autumn of that year he was in financial trouble and sent poems unk help to various acquaintances </s>
<s> He was relieved by Yan Wu a friend and former colleague who was appointed governor general at unk </s>
<s> Despite his financial problems this was one of the unk and most peaceful periods of his life </s>
<s> Many of Du s poems from this period are peaceful depictions of his life at unk unk </s>
<s> In he left the city to escape a rebellion but he returned in summer unk when he was appointed an advisor to Yan who was involved in campaigns against the unk Empire </s>
<s> Last years Luoyang the region of his birthplace was recovered by government forces in the winter of and in the spring of unk Du Fu and his family sailed down the Yangtze apparently with the intention of making their way there </s>
<s> They traveled slowly held up by his ill health by this time he was suffering from poor eyesight unk and general old age in addition to his previous unk </s>
<s> They stayed in unk in what is now unk unk at the entrance to the Three unk for almost two years from late spring unk </s>
<s> This period was Du Fu s last great poetic flowering and here he wrote poems in his dense late style </s>
<s> In autumn unk Bo unk became governor of the region he supported Du Fu financially and employed him as his unofficial secretary </s>

<s> His last known descendant is a grandson who requested a grave inscription for the poet from Yuan unk in unk </s>

<s> Below is an example of one of Du Fu s later works To My unk Friend unk Chinese unk </s>
<s> Like many other poems in the Tang it featured the theme of a long parting between friends which was often due to officials being frequently transferred to the provinces Works Criticism of Du Fu s works has focused on his strong sense of history his moral engagement and his technical excellence </s>
<s> History Since the Song dynasty critics have called Du Fu the poet historian unk unk unk </s>
<s> The most directly historical of his poems are those commenting on military tactics or the successes and failures of the government or the poems of advice which he wrote to the emperor </s>
<s> unk he wrote about the effect of the times in which he lived on himself and on the ordinary people of China </s>
<s> As Watson notes this is information of a kind seldom found in the officially compiled histories of the era </s>
<s> Du Fu s political comments are based on emotion rather than calculation his unk have been unk as Let us all be less selfish let us all do what we are supposed to do </s>
<s> Since his views were impossible to disagree with his unk expressed unk enabled his installation as the central figure of Chinese poetic history </s>
<s> unk engagement A second favourite epithet of Chinese critics is that of poet sage unk unk unk a counterpart to the philosophical sage unk </s>
<s> One of the earliest surviving works The Song of the unk from around gives voice to the unk of a unk soldier in the imperial army and a clear sighted consciousness of suffering </s>
<s> These concerns are continuously articulated in poems on the lives of both soldiers and civilians produced by Du Fu throughout his life </s>
<s> Although Du Fu s frequent references to his own difficulties can give the impression of an all consuming unk Hawkes argues that his famous compassion in fact includes himself viewed quite unk and almost as an unk </s>
<s> He therefore lends grandeur to the wider picture by comparing it to his own slightly comical triviality </s>
<s> Du Fu s compassion for himself and for others was part of his general broadening of the scope of poetry he devoted many works to topics which had previously been considered unsuitable for poetic treatment </s>
<s> Zhang Jie wrote that for Du Fu everything in this world is poetry Du wrote extensively on subjects such as domestic life calligraphy paintings animals and other poems </s>
<s> Technical excellence Du Fu s work is notable above all for its range </s>
<s> Chinese critics traditionally used the term unk unk complete unk a reference to unk description of unk </s>
<s> Yuan unk was the first to note the breadth of Du Fu s achievement writing in unk that his predecessor united in his work traits which previous men had displayed only singly </s>
<s> He mastered all the forms of Chinese poetry Chou says that in every form he either made outstanding advances or contributed outstanding examples </s>
<s> Furthermore his poems use a wide range of registers from the direct and unk to the unk and self consciously literary </s>
<s> This variety is unk even within individual works Owen identifies the rapid stylistic and thematic shifts in poems which enable the poet to represent different unk of a situation while Chou uses the term juxtaposition as the major analytical tool in her work </s>
<s> Du Fu is noted for having written more on unk and painting than any other writer of his time </s>
<s> He wrote eighteen poems on painting alone more than any other Tang poet </s>
<s> Du Fu s seemingly negative commentary on the prized horse paintings of Han unk unk a controversy that has persisted to the present day </s>
<s> The tenor of his work changed as he developed his style and adapted to his surroundings unk like according to Watson his earliest works are in a relatively derivative courtly style but he came into his own in the years of the rebellion </s>
<s> Owen comments on the unk simplicity of the unk poems which mirrors the desert landscape the works from his unk period are light often finely observed while the poems from the late unk period have a density and power of vision </s>
<s> Although he wrote in all poetic forms Du Fu is best known for his unk a type of poem with strict constraints on form and content for example About two thirds of Du Fu s extant works are in this form and he is generally considered to be its leading exponent </s>
<s> His best unk use the unk required by the form to add expressive content rather than as mere technical restrictions </s>
<s> Hawkes comments that it is amazing that Tu Fu is able to use so immensely stylized a form in so natural a manner </s>
<s> Influence According to the unk Britannica Du Fu s writings are considered by many literary critics to be among the greatest of all time and it states his dense compressed language makes use of all the unk overtones of a phrase and of all the unk unk of the individual word qualities that no translation can ever reveal </s>
<s> In his lifetime and immediately following his death Du Fu was not greatly appreciated </s>
<s> In part this can be attributed to his stylistic and formal innovations some of which are still considered extremely daring and bizarre by Chinese critics </s>
<s> There are few contemporary references to him only eleven poems from six writers and these describe him in terms of affection but not as a unk of poetic or moral ideals </s>
<s> Du Fu is also poorly represented in contemporary anthologies of poetry </s>
<s> However as unk notes he is the only Chinese poet whose influence grew with time and his works began to increase in popularity in the ninth century </s>
<s> Early positive comments came from unk unk who praised the moral sentiments of some of Du Fu s works although he found these in only a small fraction of the poems and from Han Yu who wrote a piece defending Du Fu and Li unk on aesthetic grounds from attacks made against them </s>
<s> Both these writers showed the influence of Du Fu in their own poetic work </s>
<s> By the beginning of the century unk unk constructed the first replica of his unk cottage in Sichuan </s>
<s> It was in the century during the Northern Song era that Du Fu s reputation reached its peak </s>
<s> In this period a comprehensive re evaluation of earlier poets took place in which Wang unk Li unk and Du Fu came to be regarded as representing respectively the Buddhist unk and Confucian strands of Chinese culture </s>
<s> At the same time the development of Neo unk ensured that Du Fu as its poetic unk occupied the paramount position </s>
<s> Su Shi famously expressed this reasoning when he wrote that Du Fu was unk because through all his unk he never for the space of a meal unk his sovereign </s>
<s> His influence was helped by his ability to reconcile apparent opposites political unk were attracted by his loyalty to the established order while political radicals embraced his concern for the poor </s>
<s> Literary unk could look to his technical mastery while literary radicals were inspired by his innovations </s>
<s> Since the establishment of the People s Republic of China Du Fu s loyalty to the state and concern for the poor have been interpreted as embryonic nationalism and socialism and he has been praised for his use of simple people s language </s>
<s> Du Fu s popularity grew to such an extent that it is as hard to measure his influence as that of Shakespeare in England it was hard for any Chinese poet not to be influenced by him </s>
<s> While there was never another Du Fu individual poets followed in the traditions of specific aspects of his work unk unk s concern for the poor Lu You s patriotism and unk unk s unk on the unk are a few examples </s>
<s> More broadly Du Fu s work in transforming the unk from mere word play into a vehicle for serious poetic unk set the stage for every subsequent writer in the genre </s>
<s> In the century he was the favourite poet of Kenneth unk who has described him as the greatest non epic non dramatic poet who has survived in any language and commented that he has made me a better man as a moral agent and as a unk organism </s>
<s> Influence on Japanese literature Du Fu s poetry has made a profound impact on Japanese literature especially on the literature from the unk period and on scholars and poets in the Edo period including unk unk the very greatest of all unk poets </s>
<s> Even in modern Japanese the term Saint of Poetry unk unk is mostly synonymous with Du Fu </s>
<s> Until the century the Japanese preferred unk unk above all poets and there were few references to Du Fu although his influence can be seen in some unk Chinese poetry made by Japanese poets anthologies such as unk unk in the century </s>
<s> The first notable Japanese unk of Du Fu s poetry was unk unk unk unk a unk unk patriarch and one of the most prominent authors of the literature of the Five Mountains he highly praised Du Fu and made a commentary on some poems of Du Fu from the perspective of a unk priest in Vol </s>
<s> of unk </s>

<s> unk unk to reply Yes if you do have enough capability </s>
<s> No if do not </s>

<s> unk A variety of styles have been used in efforts to translate Du Fu s work into English </s>
<s> As Burton Watson remarks in The Selected Poems of Du Fu There are many different ways to approach the problems involved in translating Du Fu which is why we need as many different translations as possible unk unk </s>
<s> The translators have had to contend with bringing out the formal constraints of the original without sounding unk to a Western ear particularly when translating regulated verse or unk and unk the complex allusions contained particularly in the later works Hawkes writes that his poems do not as a rule come through very well in translation unk unk </s>
<s> One extreme on each issue is represented by Kenneth unk s One Hundred Poems From the Chinese </s>
<s> His are free translations which seek to conceal the unk through unk and expansion and contraction of the content his responses to the allusions are firstly to unk most of these poems from his selection and unk to translate out the references in those works which he does select </s>
<s> Other translators have placed much greater weight on trying to convey a sense of the poetic forms used by Du Fu </s>
<s> Vikram Seth in Three Chinese Poets uses English style rhyme schemes whereas Keith unk in Facing the Moon unk the Chinese rhyme scheme both use end stopped lines and preserve some degree of unk </s>
<s> In The Selected Poems of Du Fu Burton Watson follows the unk quite strictly persuading the western reader to adapt to the poems rather than vice versa </s>
<s> Similarly he deals with the allusion of the later works by combining literal translation with extensive unk </s>
<s> In Stephen Owen published translations with facing Chinese texts of the complete poetry of Du Fu in six volumes with extensive scholarly apparatus which emphasized unk </s>
<s> Kiss You One Direction song Kiss You is a song recorded by English Irish boy band One Direction for their second studio album Take Me Home </s>
<s> It was released as the record s second single in Germany and the third overall single on January </s>
<s> The song was composed by unk unk unk Lundin unk unk unk unk unk and its producers Carl unk and unk unk </s>
<s> Kiss You is an upbeat power pop song with electronic effects the lyrics detail a protagonist s infatuation with a significant other </s>
<s> Critics praised the song for its production calling it a stand out track on Take Me Home </s>
<s> The track became the group s sixth top ten hit in Ireland and the United Kingdom while attaining top forty positions in both Belgian territories Flanders and Wallonia as well as in Australia Canada Denmark France New Zealand and the Netherlands </s>
<s> The single peaked at number on the US Billboard Hot and has been certified gold by the Recording Industry Association of America RIAA for shipments of copies </s>
<s> One Direction performed Kiss You on both the UK and US versions of The X Factor and major concert tours Take Me Home Tour Where We Are Tour and On the Road Again Tour </s>
<s> An accompanying music video designed to display the group s comedic timing was directed by Vaughan unk who had previously worked with the group on two other music videos </s>

<s> The track features electronic effects colossal hooks a na na na breakdown and a Motown unk melody </s>

<s> Charts Certifications Release history unk class battleship The unk class battleships unk unk unk unk were a pair of dreadnought battleships built for the Imperial Japanese Navy unk during World War I </s>
<s> Originally intended to be repeats of the preceding unk class they were redesigned before construction began </s>
<s> Both ships carried supplies for the survivors of the Great unk earthquake in </s>
<s> They were modernized in with improvements to their armour and machinery and a rebuilt superstructure in the pagoda mast style </s>
<s> Afterwards they played a minor role in the Second unk Japanese War </s>
<s> Despite the expensive reconstructions both vessels were considered obsolete by the eve of the Pacific War and neither saw significant action in the early years of the war </s>
<s> Following the loss of most of the unk s large aircraft carriers during the Battle of Midway in mid they were rebuilt with a flight deck replacing the rear pair of gun turrets to give them the ability to operate an air group of unk </s>
<s> A lack of aircraft and qualified pilots however meant that they never actually operated their aircraft in combat </s>
<s> While awaiting their air group the sister ships were sometimes used to ferry troops and material to Japanese bases </s>
<s> They participated in the Battle of Cape unk in late where they unk the American carrier fleet supporting the invasion of unk away from the landing beaches </s>
<s> Afterwards both ships were transferred to Southeast Asia in early they participated in Operation unk where they transported petrol and other strategic materials to Japan </s>
<s> The sisters were then reduced to reserve until they were sunk during American airstrikes in July </s>
<s> After the war they were scrapped in </s>
<s> Background The design of the unk class battleships was shaped both by the ongoing international naval arms race and a desire among Japanese naval planners to maintain a fleet of capital ships powerful enough to defeat the United States Navy in an encounter in Japanese territorial waters </s>
<s> The unk s fleet of battleships had proven highly successful in the last year of the Russo Japanese War which culminated in the destruction of the Russian Second and Third Pacific Squadrons at the Battle of unk </s>
<s> In the aftermath the Japanese Empire immediately turned its focus to the two remaining rivals for imperial dominance in the Pacific Ocean Britain and the United States </s>
<s> unk unk a Japanese Navy admiral and military theorist speculated that conflict would inevitably arise between Japan and at least one of its two main rivals </s>
<s> To that end he called for the Japanese Navy to maintain a fleet with at least as many capital ships as the US Navy </s>
<s> This ratio unk theorized would enable the Imperial Japanese Navy to defeat the US Navy in one major battle in Japanese waters in any eventual conflict </s>
<s> Accordingly the Imperial Defence Policy called for the construction of a battle fleet of eight modern battleships long tons t each and eight modern armoured cruisers long tons unk t each </s>
<s> This was the genesis of the Eight Eight Fleet Program the development of a cohesive battle line of sixteen capital ships </s>
<s> The launch of HMS unk in by the Royal Navy raised the stakes and complicated Japan s plans </s>
<s> unk long tons t and armed with ten inch </s>
<s> cm guns unk rendered all existing battleships obsolete by comparison </s>
<s> The launch of the battlecruiser HMS Invincible the following year was a further setback for Japan s quest for parity </s>
<s> When the two new unk class battleships and two unk class armoured cruisers launched by were unk by their British counterparts the Eight Eight Fleet Program was unk </s>
<s> The first battleships built for the renewed Eight Eight Fleet Program were the two dreadnoughts of the unk class ordered in and laid down in </s>
<s> In the Navy put forward a request to the Diet parliament to secure funding for the entirety of the program at once </s>
<s> Because of economic constraints only four battlecruisers and a single battleship of the unk class were ultimately approved by the Diet </s>
<s> Three more unk class ships unk unk and unk were approved and all three were ordered in April </s>
<s> While unk was laid down later that year the unk lacked the funding to proceed with the construction of unk and unk until the Diet authorized additional funding for the ships in July </s>
<s> Design and description The progress of unk s construction while the unk waited for the funding to be released and foreign developments caused the unk to unk the unk class design </s>

<s> kilogram </s>

<s> in gun that offset its lighter shell weight with a higher rate of fire </s>

<s> Ships Service Upon commissioning the sister ships were assigned to the Battleship Division of the Fleet </s>

<s> World War II When Japan began the Pacific War on December the sisters sortied for the unk Islands with four other battleships and the light carrier unk as distant cover for the fleet attacking Pearl Harbor and returned six days later </s>

<s> that disabled both guns and killed crewmen </s>

<s> Treasure Coast hurricane The Treasure Coast hurricane was the second most intense tropical cyclone to strike the United States during the active Atlantic hurricane season </s>
<s> The eleventh tropical storm fifth hurricane and the third major hurricane of the season it formed east northeast of the Leeward Islands on August </s>
<s> The tropical storm moved rapidly west northwestward steadily intensifying to a hurricane </s>
<s> It acquired peak winds of miles per hour km h and passed over portions of the Bahamas on September including unk and Harbour Island causing severe damage to crops buildings and infrastructure </s>
<s> Winds over mph km h affected many islands in its path especially those that encountered its center and many wharves were ruined </s>
<s> Subsequently it weakened and made landfall at Jupiter Florida early on September with winds of mph km h </s>
<s> The hurricane moved across the state passing near Tampa before moving into Georgia and dissipating </s>
<s> In Florida the strong winds of the cyclone blew buildings off their foundations and numerous trees were unk in citrus groves </s>
<s> The Treasure Coast region received the most extensive destruction and Stuart Jupiter and Fort Pierce were heavily damaged </s>
<s> Inland the cyclone weakened rapidly but produced prodigious amounts of rain causing a dam to collapse near Tampa </s>
<s> The storm caused million in damage USD after damaging or destroying unk homes </s>
<s> Unusually the storm hit Florida less than hours before another major hurricane bearing mile per hour km h winds struck South Texas never have two major cyclones hit the United States in such close succession </s>
<s> Meteorological history The origins of the hurricane were from a tropical wave that possibly spawned a tropical depression on August although there was minimal data over the next few days as it tracked to the west northwest </s>
<s> On August a nearby ship reported gale force winds which indicated that a tropical storm had developed to the east northeast of the Lesser Antilles </s>
<s> Based on continuity it is estimated the storm attained hurricane status later that day </s>
<s> Moving quickly to the west northwest the storm passed north of the Lesser Antilles and Puerto Rico </s>
<s> Early on September a ship called the unk reported a barometric pressure of mbar </s>
<s> inHg which confirmed that the storm attained hurricane status </s>
<s> After passing north of the Turks and unk islands the hurricane struck unk and Harbour Island in the Bahamas on September the latter at UTC </s>
<s> A station on the latter island reported a pressure of </s>
<s> inHg unk mb during the minute passage of the eye </s>
<s> Based on the pressure and the small size of the storm it is estimated the hurricane struck Harbour Island with peak winds of mph km h making it the equivalent of a modern Category hurricane on the Saffir Simpson scale </s>
<s> unk suggested that the storm reached major hurricane status or Category status on September </s>
<s> The hurricane initially followed the course of another hurricane that passed through the area in late August which ultimately struck Cuba and Texas </s>
<s> This hurricane instead maintained a general west northwest track </s>

<s> inHg unk mb during a minute period of the eye s passage this suggested a landfall strength of mph km h </s>

<s> Second Battle of unk unk The Second Battle of unk unk was an engagement between United Nations UN and North Korean unk forces early in the Korean War from September to September along the unk River in South Korea </s>
<s> It was a part of the Battle of Pusan Perimeter and was one of several large engagements fought simultaneously </s>
<s> The battle ended in a victory for the United Nations after large numbers of United States US and Republic of Korea ROK troops repelled a strong North Korean attack </s>
<s> After the First Battle of unk unk the US Army s Infantry Division was moved to defend the unk River line </s>
<s> The division which was unk in combat was struck with a strong attack by several divisions of the Korean People s Army which crossed the river and struck all along the division s line </s>
<s> The force of the attack split the US Infantry Division in half and the North Koreans were able to penetrate to unk promoting a fight there </s>
<s> The urgency of the threat to Pusan Perimeter prompted the US Marine Corps Provisional Marine Brigade to be brought in to reinforce the US Army troops </s>
<s> In two weeks of heavy fighting the US forces were able to force the North Koreans out of the unk unk region </s>
<s> The North Koreans were further repulsed after the UN counterattack at unk which culminated in the virtual destruction of the North Korean army </s>
<s> Background Pusan Perimeter From the outbreak of the Korean War and the invasion of South Korea by the North the North Korean People s Army had enjoyed superiority in both manpower and equipment over both the Republic of Korea Army and the United Nations forces dispatched to South Korea to prevent it from collapsing </s>
<s> The North Korean strategy was to aggressively pursue UN and ROK forces on all avenues of approach south and to engage them aggressively attacking from the front and initiating a double unk of both flanks of the unit which allowed the North Koreans to surround and cut off the opposing force which would then be forced to retreat in unk often leaving behind much of its equipment </s>
<s> From their initial June offensive to fights in July and early August the North Koreans used this strategy to effectively defeat any UN force and push it south </s>
<s> However when the UN forces under the Eighth United States Army established the Pusan Perimeter in August the UN troops held a continuous line along the peninsula which North Korean troops could not flank and their advantages in numbers decreased daily as the superior UN logistical system brought in more troops and supplies to the UN army </s>
<s> When the North Koreans approached the Pusan Perimeter on August they attempted the same frontal assault technique on the four main avenues of approach into the perimeter </s>
<s> Throughout August the unk Division and later the unk Division engaged the US Infantry Division at the Battle of unk initially unk a UN counteroffensive before unk with battles at unk unk and Battle Mountain </s>
<s> These attacks stalled as UN forces well equipped and with plenty of reserves repeatedly repelled North Korean attacks </s>

<s> unk warship An ironclad is a steam propelled warship protected by iron or steel armor plates used in the early part of the second half of the century </s>
<s> The ironclad was developed as a result of the vulnerability of wooden warships to explosive or incendiary shells </s>
<s> The first ironclad battleship Gloire was launched by the French Navy in November </s>
<s> The British Admiralty had been considering armored warships since and prepared a draft design for an armored unk in in early the Royal Navy started building two iron unk armored frigates and by had made the decision to move to an all armored battle fleet </s>
<s> After the first clashes of ironclads both with wooden ships and with one another took place in during the American Civil War it became clear that the ironclad had replaced the unk ship of the line as the most powerful warship afloat </s>
<s> This type of ship would come to be very successful in the American Civil War </s>
<s> unk were designed for several roles including as high seas battleships coastal defense ships and long range cruisers </s>
<s> The rapid evolution of warship design in the late century transformed the ironclad from a wooden unk vessel that carried sails to supplement its steam engines into the steel built unk battleships and cruisers familiar in the century </s>
<s> This change was pushed forward by the development of heavier naval guns the ironclads of the carried some of the heaviest guns ever mounted at sea more sophisticated steam engines and advances in metallurgy which made steel shipbuilding possible </s>
<s> The quick pace of change meant that many ships were obsolete as soon as they were finished and that naval tactics were in a state of flux </s>
<s> Many ironclads were built to make use of the ram or the torpedo which a number of naval designers considered the important weapons of naval combat </s>
<s> There is no clear end to the ironclad period but towards the end of the the term ironclad dropped out of use </s>
<s> New ships were increasingly constructed to a standard pattern and designated battleships or armored cruisers </s>
<s> The ironclad The ironclad became technically feasible and tactically necessary because of developments in shipbuilding in the first half of the century </s>
<s> According to naval historian J Richard Hill The ironclad had three chief characteristics a metal skinned hull steam propulsion and a main armament of guns capable of firing explosive shells </s>
<s> It is only when all three characteristics are present that a fighting ship can properly be called an ironclad </s>
<s> Each of these developments was introduced separately in the decade before the first ironclads </s>
<s> Steam propulsion In the and early centuries fleets had relied on two types of major warship the ship of the line and the frigate </s>
<s> The first major change to these types was the introduction of steam power for propulsion </s>
<s> While unk steamer warships had been used from the onwards steam propulsion only became suitable for major warships after the adoption of the screw propeller in the </s>
<s> Steam powered screw frigates were built in the mid and at the end of the decade the French Navy introduced steam power to its line of battle </s>
<s> The desire for change came from the ambition of Napoleon III to gain greater influence in Europe which required a challenge to the British at sea </s>
<s> The first purpose built steam battleship was the gun Napolon in </s>
<s> Napolon was armed as a conventional ship of the line but her steam engines could give her a speed of knots km h regardless of the wind conditions a potentially decisive advantage in a naval engagement </s>
<s> The introduction of the steam ship of the line led to a building competition between France and Britain </s>
<s> Eight sister ships to Napolon were built in France over a period of ten years but the United Kingdom soon managed to take the lead in production </s>
<s> unk France built ten new wooden steam battleships and converted from older ships of the line while the United Kingdom built and converted </s>
<s> unk shells The era of the wooden steam ship of the line was brief because of new more powerful naval guns </s>
<s> In the and warships began to mount increasingly heavy guns replacing and pounder guns with pounders on sailing ships of the line and introducing pounders on unk </s>
<s> Then the first shell guns firing explosive shells were introduced following their development by the French unk Henri Joseph unk and by the were part of the standard armament for naval powers including the French Navy Royal Navy Imperial Russian Navy and United States Navy </s>
<s> It is often held that the power of explosive shells to smash wooden hulls as demonstrated by the Russian destruction of an Ottoman squadron at the Battle of unk spelled the end of the wooden unk warship </s>
<s> The more practical threat to wooden ships was from conventional cannon firing red hot shot which could unk in the hull of a wooden ship and cause a fire or ammunition explosion </s>
<s> Some navies even experimented with hollow shot filled with molten metal for extra incendiary power </s>
<s> Iron armor The use of iron instead of wood as the primary material of ships hulls began in the the first warship with an iron hull was the gunboat unk built by Laird for the East India Company in </s>
<s> There followed also from Laird the first full blown warships with metal hulls the steam frigates unk and unk for the Mexican navy </s>
<s> But a thin iron skin while not being susceptible to fire or lethal unk like wood was not the same thing as providing iron armor calculated to stop enemy gunfire </s>
<s> Following the demonstration of the power of explosive shells against wooden ships at the Battle of unk and fearing that his own ships would be vulnerable to the unk guns of Russian fortifications in the Crimean War Emperor Napoleon III ordered the development of light draft floating batteries equipped with heavy guns and protected by heavy armor </s>
<s> Experiments made during the first half of proved highly satisfactory and on July the French communicated to the British Government that a solution had been found to make gun proof vessels and that plans would be communicated </s>
<s> After tests in September the British Admiralty agreed to build five armoured floating batteries on the French plans establishing the important Thames and unk Iron Works within the docks </s>
<s> The French floating batteries were deployed in as a supplement to the wooden steam battle fleet in the Crimean War </s>
<s> The role of the battery was to assist unk mortar and gunboats bombarding shore fortifications </s>
<s> The French used three of their ironclad batteries unk unk and unk in against the defenses at the Battle of unk on the Black Sea where they were effective against Russian shore defences </s>
<s> They would later be used again during the Italian war in the Adriatic in </s>
<s> The British floating batteries unk and Meteor arrived too late to participate to the action at unk </s>
<s> The British planned to use theirs in the Baltic Sea against the well fortified naval base at unk </s>
<s> The batteries have a claim to the title of the first ironclad warships but they were capable of only knots km h under their own power they operated under their own power at the Battle of unk but had to be towed for long range transit </s>
<s> They were also arguably marginal to the work of the navy </s>
<s> The brief success of the floating ironclad batteries convinced France to begin work on armored warships for their unk </s>
<s> Early ironclad ships and battles By the end of the it was clear that France was unable to match British building of steam warships and to regain the strategic initiative a dramatic change was required </s>
<s> The result was the first ocean going ironclad the Gloire begun in and launched in </s>
<s> Gloire s wooden hull was modelled on that of a steam ship of the line reduced to one deck unk in iron plates </s>
<s> inches mm thick </s>
<s> She was propelled by a steam engine driving a single screw propeller for a speed of knots km h </s>
<s> She was armed with thirty six </s>
<s> inch mm rifled guns </s>
<s> France proceeded to construct ironclad warships including two more sister ships to Gloire and the only two unk broadside ironclads ever built unk and unk </s>
<s> The Royal Navy had not been keen to sacrifice its advantage in steam ships of the line but was determined that the first British ironclad would unk the French ships in every respect particularly speed </s>
<s> A fast ship would have the advantage of being able to choose a range of engagement which could make her unk to enemy fire </s>
<s> The British specification was more a large powerful frigate than a ship of the line </s>
<s> The requirement for speed meant a very long vessel which had to be built from iron </s>
<s> The result was the construction of two Warrior class ironclads HMS Warrior and HMS Black Prince </s>
<s> The ships had a successful design though there were necessarily compromises between sea keeping strategic range and armour protection their weapons were more effective than that of Gloire and with the largest set of steam engines yet fitted to a ship they could steam at </s>
<s> knots </s>
<s> km h </s>
<s> Yet the Gloire and her sisters had full iron armour protection along the waterline and the battery itself </s>
<s> Warrior and Black Prince but also the smaller Defence and Resistance were obliged to concentrate their armour in a central citadel or armoured box leaving many main deck guns and the fore and aft sections of the vessel unprotected </s>
<s> The use of iron in the construction of Warrior also came with some drawbacks iron hulls required more regular and intensive repairs than wooden hulls and iron was more susceptible to unk by marine life </s>
<s> By navies across Europe had adopted ironclads </s>
<s> Britain and France each had sixteen either completed or under construction though the British vessels were larger </s>
<s> Austria Italy Russia and Spain were also building ironclads </s>
<s> However the first battles using the new ironclad ships involved neither Britain nor France and involved ships markedly different from the broadside firing unk designs of Gloire and Warrior </s>
<s> The use of ironclads by both sides in the American Civil War and the clash of the Italian and Austrian fleets at the Battle of unk had an important influence on the development of ironclad design </s>
<s> First battles between ironclads the US Civil War The first use of ironclads in action came in the US Civil War </s>
<s> The US Navy at the time the war broke out had no ironclads its most powerful ships being six steam powered unk frigates </s>
<s> Since the bulk of the Navy remained loyal to the Union the Confederacy sought to gain advantage in the naval conflict by acquiring modern armored ships </s>
<s> In May the Confederate Congress voted that million be appropriated for the purchase of ironclads from overseas and in July and August the Confederacy started work on construction and converting wooden ships </s>
<s> On October the CSS unk became the first ironclad to enter combat when she fought Union warships on the Mississippi during the Battle of the Head of unk </s>
<s> She had been converted from a commercial vessel in New Orleans for river and coastal fighting </s>
<s> In February the larger CSS Virginia joined the Confederate Navy having been rebuilt at Norfolk </s>
<s> unk on the hull of USS unk Virginia originally was a conventional warship made of wood but she was converted into an iron covered casemate ironclad unk when she entered the Confederate navy </s>
<s> By this time the Union had completed seven ironclad gunboats of the City class and was about to complete the USS unk an innovative design proposed by the Swedish inventor John Ericsson </s>
<s> The Union was also building a large armored frigate the USS New unk and the smaller USS unk </s>
<s> The first battle between ironclads happened on March as the armored unk was deployed to protect the Union s wooden fleet from the ironclad ram Virginia and other Confederate warships </s>
<s> In this engagement the second day of the Battle of Hampton Roads the two ironclads repeatedly tried to ram one another while shells bounced off their armor </s>
<s> The battle attracted attention worldwide making it clear that the wooden warship was now out of date with the ironclads destroying them easily </s>
<s> The Civil War saw more ironclads built by both sides and they played an increasing role in the naval war alongside the unk warships commerce raiders and blockade runners </s>
<s> The Union built a large fleet of fifty monitors modeled on their namesake </s>
<s> The Confederacy built ships designed as smaller versions of the Virginia many of which saw action but their attempts to buy ironclads overseas were frustrated as European nations confiscated ships being built for the Confederacy especially in Russia the only country to openly support the Union through the war </s>
<s> Only CSS unk was completed and she arrived in American waters just in time for the end of the war </s>
<s> Through the remainder of the war ironclads saw action in the Union s attacks on Confederate ports </s>
<s> Seven Union monitors including USS unk as well as two other ironclads the ironclad frigate New unk and a light draft USS unk participated in the failed attack on Charleston one was sunk </s>
<s> Two small ironclads CSS unk State and CSS unk participated in the defence of the harbor </s>
<s> For the later attack at Mobile Bay the Union assembled four monitors as well as wooden ships facing the CSS Tennessee the Confederacy s most powerful ironclad and the gunboats CSS Morgan CSS Gaines CSS Selma </s>
<s> On the western front the Union built a formidable force of river ironclads beginning with several converted unk and then contracting engineer James unk of St Louis Missouri to build the City class ironclads </s>
<s> These excellent ships were built with twin engines and a central unk wheel all protected by an armored unk </s>
<s> They had a shallow draft allowing them to journey up smaller tributaries and were very well suited for river operations </s>
<s> unk also produced monitors for use on the rivers the first two of which differed from the ocean going monitors in that they contained a unk wheel the USS unk and USS Osage </s>
<s> unk unk vessels were some of the better ironclads of the Western Flotilla but there were a number of other vessels that served unk with the fleet </s>
<s> All were of varying design some more successful than others and some were similar to standard unk but with armored side mounted unk wheels </s>
<s> All were armed with various smoothbore and some rifled guns </s>
<s> If nothing else the experience of the American Civil War and its wild variety of competing ironclad designs some more successful or disastrous than others confirmed the emerging trade off or compromises required in applying the latest technological advances in iron armour manufacture ship construction and gun design to name a few also going on in Europe </s>
<s> There was no such thing as a perfect ironclad which could be unk in every possible encounter ship duels standing up to forts Brown Blue water operations </s>
<s> The Union ironclads played an important role in the Mississippi and tributaries by providing tremendous fire upon Confederate forts installations and vessels with relative unk to enemy fire </s>
<s> They were not as heavily armored as the ocean going monitors of the Union but they were adequate for their intended use </s>
<s> More Western Flotilla Union ironclads were sunk by torpedoes mines than by enemy fire and the most damaging fire for the Union ironclads was from shore installations not Confederate vessels </s>
<s> unk First fleet battle The first fleet battle and the first ocean battle involving ironclad warships was the Battle of unk in </s>
<s> unk between the Austrian and Italian navies the battle pitted combined fleets of wooden frigates and unk and ironclad warships on both sides in the largest naval battle between the battles of unk and unk </s>
<s> The Italian fleet consisted of ironclads and a similar number of wooden warships escorting transports which carried troops intending to land on the Adriatic island of unk </s>
<s> Among the Italian ironclads were seven broadside ironclad frigates four smaller ironclads and the newly built unk a double unk ram </s>
<s> unk them the Austrian navy had seven ironclad frigates </s>
<s> The Austrians believed their ships to have less effective guns than their enemy so decided to engage the Italians at close range and ram them </s>
<s> The Austrian fleet formed into an unk formation with the ironclads in the first line charging at the Italian ironclad squadron </s>
<s> In the unk which followed both sides were frustrated by the lack of damage inflicted by guns and by the difficulty of unk nonetheless the effective unk attack being made by the Austrian flagship against the Italian attracted great attention in following years </s>
<s> The superior Italian fleet lost its two ironclads Re d Italia and Palestro while the Austrian unk screw two unk SMS Kaiser remarkably survived close actions with four Italian ironclads </s>
<s> The battle ensured the popularity of the ram as a weapon in European ironclads for many years and the victory won by Austria established it as the predominant naval power in the Adriatic </s>
<s> The battles of the American Civil War and at unk were very influential on the designs and tactics of the ironclad fleets that followed </s>
<s> In particular it taught a generation of naval officers the misleading lesson that unk was the best way to sink enemy ironclads </s>
<s> Armament and tactics The adoption of iron armor meant that the traditional naval armament of dozens of light cannon became useless since their shot would bounce off an armored hull </s>
<s> To penetrate armor increasingly heavy guns were mounted on ships nevertheless the view that unk was the only way to sink an ironclad became widespread </s>
<s> The increasing size and weight of guns also meant a movement away from the ships mounting many guns broadside in the manner of a ship of the line towards a handful of guns in turrets for all round fire </s>
<s> Ram craze From the to the many naval designers believed that the development of the ironclad meant that the ram was again the most important weapon in naval warfare </s>
<s> With steam power freeing ships from the wind and armor making them unk to unk the ram seemed to offer the opportunity to strike a decisive blow </s>
<s> The unk damage inflicted by the guns of unk and Virginia at Battle of Hampton Roads and the spectacular but lucky success of the Austrian flagship SMS Erzherzog Ferdinand Max sinking the Italian Re d Italia at unk gave strength to the unk craze </s>
<s> From the early to early most British naval officers thought that guns were about to be replaced as the main naval armament by the ram </s>
<s> Those who noted the tiny number of ships that had actually been sunk by unk struggled to be heard </s>
<s> The revival of unk had a significant effect on naval tactics </s>
<s> Since the century the predominant tactic of naval warfare had been the line of battle where a fleet formed a long line to give it the best fire from its broadside guns </s>
<s> This tactic was totally unsuited to unk and the ram threw fleet tactics into unk </s>
<s> The question of how an ironclad fleet should deploy in battle to make best use of the ram was never tested in battle and if it had been combat might have shown that rams could only be used against ships which were already stopped dead in the water </s>
<s> The ram finally fell out of favour in the as the same effect could be achieved with a torpedo with less vulnerability to quick firing guns </s>
<s> Development of naval guns The armament of ironclads tended to become concentrated in a small number of powerful guns capable of penetrating the armor of enemy ships at range calibre and weight of guns increased markedly to achieve greater penetration </s>
<s> Throughout the ironclad era navies also unk with the unk of rifled versus smoothbore guns and breech loading versus muzzle loading </s>
<s> HMS Warrior carried a mixture of pounder inch mm breech loading rifles and more traditional pounder smoothbore guns </s>
<s> Warrior highlighted the challenges of picking the right armament the breech unk she carried designed by Sir William Armstrong were intended to be the next generation of heavy armament for the Royal Navy but were shortly withdrawn from service </s>
<s> unk loading guns seemed to offer important advantages </s>
<s> A breech unk could be unk without moving the gun a lengthy process particularly if the gun then needed to be re aimed </s>
<s> The Warrior s Armstrong guns also had the virtue of being lighter than an equivalent smoothbore and because of their unk more accurate </s>
<s> Nonetheless the design was rejected because of problems which plagued breech unk for decades </s>
<s> The weakness of the breech unk was the obvious problem of sealing the breech </s>
<s> All guns are powered by the explosive conversion of gunpowder into gas </s>
<s> This explosion unk the shot or shell out of the front of the gun but also unk great stresses on the gun barrel </s>
<s> If the breech which experiences some of the greatest forces in the gun is not entirely secure then there is a risk that either gas will discharge through the breech or that the breech will break </s>
<s> This in turn reduces the muzzle velocity of the weapon and can also endanger the gun crew </s>
<s> The Warrior s Armstrong guns suffered from both problems the shells were unable to penetrate the </s>
<s> in mm armor of Gloire while sometimes the screw which closed the breech flew backwards out of the gun on firing </s>
<s> Similar problems were experienced with the breech loading guns which became standard in the French and German navies </s>
<s> These problems influenced the British to equip ships with muzzle loading weapons of increasing power until the </s>
<s> After a brief introduction of pounder or </s>
<s> inch mm smoothbore Somerset Gun which weighed </s>
<s> tons </s>
<s> t the Admiralty introduced inch mm rifled guns weighing tons </s>
<s> These were followed by a series of increasingly unk weapons guns weighing and finally tons with calibre increasing from inch mm to inch mm </s>
<s> The decision to retain muzzle unk until the has been criticised by historians </s>
<s> However at least until the late the British muzzle unk had superior performance in terms of both range and rate of fire than the French and Prussian breech unk which suffered from the same problems as had the first Armstrong guns </s>
<s> From onwards the balance between unk and muzzle loading changed </s>
<s> Captain de unk invented a method of reliably sealing a breech adopted by the French in </s>
<s> Just as unk the growing size of naval guns made muzzle loading much more complicated </s>
<s> With guns of such size there was no prospect of unk in the gun for re loading or even re loading by hand and complicated hydraulic systems were required for re loading the gun outside the turret without exposing the crew to enemy fire </s>
<s> In the ton inch mm guns of HMS unk fired only once every minutes while bombarding Alexandria during the unk unk </s>
<s> The ton mm </s>
<s> inch guns of unk unk could each fire a round every minutes </s>
<s> In the Royal Navy the switch to breech unk was finally made in as well as the significant advantages in terms of performance opinion was unk by an explosion on board HMS unk caused by a gun being double loaded a problem which could only happen with a muzzle loading gun </s>
<s> The calibre and weight of guns could only increase so far </s>
<s> The larger the gun the slower it would be to load the greater the stresses on the ship s hull and the less the stability of the ship </s>
<s> The size of the gun peaked in the with some of the heaviest unk of gun ever used at sea </s>
<s> HMS unk carried two </s>
<s> inch unk mm breech loading guns each weighing tons no British battleship would ever carry guns as large </s>
<s> The Italian mm </s>
<s> inch guns would be larger than any gun fitted to a battleship until the </s>
<s> inch mm armament of the Japanese Yamato class of World War II </s>
<s> One consideration which became more acute was that even from the original Armstrong models following the Crimean War range and hitting power far exceeded simple accuracy especially at sea where the slightest roll or pitch of the vessel as floating weapons platform could unk the advantage of unk </s>
<s> American ordnance experts accordingly preferred smoothbore monsters whose round shot could at least unk along the surface of the water </s>
<s> unk effective combat ranges they had learned during the Civil War were comparable to those in the Age of unk though a vessel could now be smashed to pieces in only a few rounds </s>
<s> Smoke and the general chaos of battle only added to the problem </s>
<s> As a result many naval engagements in the Age of the unk were still fought at ranges within easy eyesight of their targets and well below the maximum reach of their ships guns </s>
<s> Another method of increasing firepower was to vary the unk fired or the nature of the propellant </s>
<s> Early ironclads used black powder which expanded rapidly after combustion this meant cannons had relatively short barrels to prevent the barrel itself slowing the shell </s>
<s> The unk of the black powder explosion also meant that guns were subjected to extreme stress </s>
<s> One important step was to press the powder into unk allowing a slower more controlled explosion and a longer barrel </s>
<s> A further step forward was the introduction of chemically different brown powder which unk more slowly again </s>
<s> It also put less stress on the unk of the barrel allowing guns to last longer and to be manufactured to unk unk </s>
<s> The development of unk powder based on unk or unk by the French inventor Paul unk in was a further step allowing smaller charges of propellant with longer barrels </s>
<s> The guns of the pre unk battleships of the tended to be smaller in calibre compared to the ships of the most often in mm but progressively grew in length of barrel making use of improved unk to gain greater muzzle velocity </s>
<s> The nature of the projectiles also changed during the ironclad period </s>
<s> Initially the best armor piercing unk was a solid cast iron shot </s>
<s> Later shot of unk iron a harder iron alloy gave better armor piercing qualities </s>
<s> Eventually the armor piercing shell was developed </s>
<s> unk of armament unk ironclads The first British French and Russian ironclads in a logical development of warship design from the long preceding era of wooden ships of the line carried their weapons in a single line along their sides and so were called broadside ironclads </s>
<s> Both Gloire and HMS Warrior were examples of this type </s>
<s> Because their armor was so heavy they could only carry a single row of guns along the main deck on each side rather than a row on each deck </s>
<s> A significant number of broadside ironclads were built in the principally in Britain and France but in smaller numbers by other powers including Italy Austria Russia and the United States </s>
<s> The advantages of mounting guns on both broadsides was that the ship could engage more than one unk at a time and the rigging did not impede the field of fire </s>
<s> unk armament also had disadvantages which became more serious as ironclad technology developed </s>
<s> unk guns to penetrate ever thicker armor meant that fewer guns could be carried </s>
<s> Furthermore the adoption of unk as an important tactic meant the need for ahead and all round fire </s>
<s> These problems led to broadside designs being superseded by designs that gave greater all round fire which included central battery turret and barbette designs </s>
<s> unk batteries and barbettes There were two main design unk to the broadside </s>
<s> In one design the guns were placed in an armoured casemate amidships this arrangement was called the box battery or centre battery </s>
<s> In the other the guns could be placed on a rotating platform to give them a broad field of fire when fully armored this arrangement was called a turret and when partially armored or unk a barbette </s>
<s> The centre battery was the simpler and during the and the more popular method </s>
<s> unk guns amidships meant the ship could be shorter and unk than a broadside type </s>
<s> The first full scale centre battery ship was HMS Bellerophon of the French laid down centre battery ironclads in which were not completed until </s>
<s> Centre battery ships often but not always had a unk unk enabling some of their guns to fire directly ahead </s>
<s> The turret was first used in naval combat on the USS unk in with a type of turret designed by the Swedish engineer John Ericsson </s>
<s> A competing turret design was proposed by the British inventor unk unk with a prototype of this installed on HMS unk in for testing and evaluation purposes </s>
<s> Ericsson s turret turned on a central spindle and unk s turned on a ring of bearings </s>
<s> unk offered the maximum arc of fire from the guns but there were significant problems with their use in the </s>
<s> The fire arc of a turret would be considerably limited by masts and rigging so they were unsuited to use on the earlier ocean going ironclads </s>
<s> The second problem was that turrets were extremely heavy </s>
<s> Ericsson was able to offer the heaviest possible turret guns and armour protection by deliberately designing a ship with very low unk </s>
<s> The weight thus saved from having a high broadside above the waterline was diverted to actual guns and armour </s>
<s> Low unk however also meant a smaller hull and therefore a smaller capacity for coal storage and therefore range of the vessel </s>
<s> In many respects the unk low unk unk and the broadside unk HMS Warrior represented two opposite extremes in what an unk was all about </s>
<s> The most dramatic attempt to compromise these two extremes or unk this circle was designed by Captain unk unk unk HMS Captain a dangerously low unk turret ship which nevertheless carried a full rig of sail and which subsequently capsized not long after her launch in </s>
<s> Her half sister HMS Monarch was restricted to firing from her turrets only on the port and starboard beams </s>
<s> The third Royal Navy ship to combine turrets and masts was HMS unk of which carried two turrets on either side of the centre line allowing both to fire fore aft and broadside </s>
<s> A lighter alternative to the turret particularly popular with the French navy was the barbette </s>
<s> These were fixed armored towers which held a gun on a unk </s>
<s> The crew was sheltered from direct fire but vulnerable to unk fire for instance from shore emplacements </s>
<s> The barbette was lighter than the turret needing less machinery and no roof armor though nevertheless some barbettes were stripped of their armor plate to reduce the top weight of their ships </s>
<s> The barbette became widely adopted in the and with the addition of an armored gun house transformed into the turrets of the pre unk battleships </s>
<s> unk The ironclad age saw the development of explosive torpedoes as naval weapons which helped unk the design and tactics of ironclad fleets </s>
<s> The first torpedoes were static mines used extensively in the American Civil War </s>
<s> That conflict also saw the development of the spar torpedo an explosive charge pushed against the hull of a warship by a small boat </s>
<s> For the first time a large warship faced a serious threat from a smaller one and given the relative unk of unk against ironclads the threat from the spar torpedo was taken seriously </s>
<s> The US Navy converted four of its monitors to become unk armored spar torpedo vessels while under construction in but these vessels never saw action </s>
<s> Another proposal the towed or Harvey torpedo involved an explosive on a line or unk either to deter a ship from unk or to make a torpedo attack by a boat less unk </s>
<s> A more practical and influential weapon was the self propelled or Whitehead torpedo </s>
<s> unk in and deployed in the the Whitehead torpedo formed part of the armament of ironclads of the like HMS unk and the Italian unk unk and Enrico unk </s>
<s> The ironclad s vulnerability to the torpedo was a key part of the critique of armored warships made by the unk unk school of naval thought it appeared that any ship armored enough to prevent destruction by gunfire would be slow enough to be easily caught by torpedo </s>
<s> In practice however the unk unk was only briefly influential and the torpedo formed part of the confusing mixture of weapons possessed by ironclads </s>
<s> Armor and construction The first ironclads were built on wooden or iron hulls and protected by wrought iron armor backed by thick wooden unk </s>
<s> unk were still being built with wooden hulls into the </s>
<s> unk iron wood and steel Using iron construction for warships offered advantages for the engineering of the hull </s>
<s> However unk iron had many military disadvantages and offered technical problems which kept wooden hulls in use for many years particularly for long range cruising warships </s>
<s> Iron ships had first been proposed for military use in the </s>
<s> In the and France Britain and the United States had all experimented with iron unk but unk gunboats and frigates </s>
<s> However the iron unk frigate was abandoned by the end of the because iron hulls were more vulnerable to solid shot iron was more brittle than wood and iron frames more likely to fall out of shape than wood </s>
<s> The unk of unk iron for warship hulls meant that iron was only adopted as a building material for battleships when protected by armor </s>
<s> However iron gave the naval architect many advantages </s>
<s> Iron allowed larger ships and more flexible design for instance the use of unk bulkheads on the lower decks </s>
<s> Warrior built of iron was longer and faster than the wooden unk Gloire </s>
<s> Iron could be produced to order and used immediately in contrast to the need to give wood a long period of unk </s>
<s> And given the large quantities of wood required to build a steam warship and the falling cost of iron iron hulls were increasingly cost effective </s>
<s> The main reason for the French use of wooden hulls for the ironclad fleet built in the was that the French iron industry could not supply enough and the main reason why Britain built its handful of wooden unk ironclads was to make best use of hulls already started and wood already bought </s>
<s> Wooden hulls continued to be used for long range and smaller ironclads because iron nevertheless had a significant disadvantage </s>
<s> Iron hulls suffered quick unk by marine life slowing the ships down unk for a European unk close to dry docks but a difficulty for long range ships </s>
<s> The only solution was to sheath the iron hull first in wood and then in copper a laborious and expensive process which made wooden construction remain attractive </s>
<s> Iron and wood were to some extent interchangeable the Japanese unk and unk ordered in were sister ships but one was built of iron and the other of composite construction </s>
<s> After steel started to be introduced as a material for construction </s>
<s> Compared to iron steel allows for greater structural strength for a lower weight </s>
<s> The French Navy led the way with the use of steel in its fleet starting with the unk laid down in and launched in </s>
<s> unk nonetheless had wrought iron armor plate and part of her exterior hull was iron rather than steel </s>
<s> Even though Britain led the world in steel production the Royal Navy was slow to adopt steel warships </s>
<s> The unk process for steel manufacture produced too many imperfections for large scale use on ships </s>
<s> French manufacturers used the unk Martin process to produce adequate steel but British technology unk behind </s>
<s> The first all steel warships built by the Royal Navy were the dispatch vessels unk and Mercury laid down in and </s>
<s> Armor and protection schemes Iron built ships used wood as part of their protection scheme </s>
<s> HMS Warrior was protected by </s>
<s> in mm of wrought iron backed by in mm of unk the strongest shipbuilding wood </s>
<s> The wood played two roles preventing unk and also preventing the shock of a hit damaging the structure of the ship </s>
<s> Later wood and iron were combined in sandwich armor for instance in HMS unk </s>
<s> Steel was also an obvious material for armor </s>
<s> It was tested in the but the steel of the time was too brittle and unk when struck by shells </s>
<s> Steel became practical to use when a way was found to fuse steel onto wrought iron plates giving a form of compound armor </s>
<s> This compound armor was used by the British in ships built from the late first for turret armor starting with HMS unk and then for all armor starting with HMS unk of </s>
<s> The French and German navies adopted the innovation almost immediately with licenses being given for the use of the Wilson System of producing fused armor </s>
<s> The first ironclads to have all steel armor were the Italian unk unk and Enrico unk </s>
<s> Though the ships were laid down in their armor was not purchased from France until </s>
<s> The French navy decided in to adopt compound armor for its fleet but found it limited in supply so from the French navy was using steel armor </s>
<s> Britain stuck to compound armor until </s>
<s> The ultimate ironclad armor was case hardened nickel steel </s>
<s> In the US Navy tested steel armor hardened by the Harvey process and found it superior to compound armor </s>
<s> For several years Harvey steel was the state of the art produced in the US France Germany Britain Austria and Italy </s>
<s> In the German firm unk developed gas unk which further hardened steel armor </s>
<s> The German Kaiser Friedrich III laid down in was the first ship to benefit from the new unk armor and the new armor was quickly adopted the Royal Navy using it from HMS Canopus laid down in </s>
<s> By almost all new battleships used unk armor though the US continued to use Harvey armor alongside until the end of the decade </s>
<s> The equivalent strengths of the different armor plates was as follows in mm of wrought iron was equivalent to in mm of either plain steel or compound iron and steel armor and to </s>
<s> in mm of Harvey armor or </s>
<s> in mm of unk armor </s>
<s> unk construction also unk the later debate in battleship design between unk and all or nothing armour design </s>
<s> Warrior was only semi armoured and could have been disabled by hits on the bow and stern </s>
<s> As the thickness of armor grew to protect ships from the increasingly heavy guns the area of the ship which could be fully protected diminished </s>
<s> unk s armor protection was largely limited to the central citadel amidships protecting boilers and engines turrets and magazines and little else </s>
<s> An ingenious arrangement of unk filled compartments and unk bulkheads was intended to keep her stable and afloat in the event of heavy damage to her un armored sections </s>
<s> unk steam and sail The first ocean going ironclads carried masts and sails like their wooden predecessors and these features were only gradually abandoned </s>
<s> Early steam engines were inefficient the wooden steam fleet of the Royal Navy could only carry to days coal and the situation was similar with the early ironclads </s>
<s> Warrior also illustrates two design features which aided hybrid propulsion she had retractable screws to reduce drag while under sail though in practice the steam engine was run at a low unk and a unk funnel which could be folded down to the deck level </s>
<s> Ships designed for coastal warfare like the floating batteries of the unk or USS unk and her sisters unk with masts from the beginning </s>
<s> The British HMS unk started in was the first large ocean going ironclad to unk with masts </s>

<s> Most ironclads of the retained masts and only the Italian navy which during that decade was focused on short range operations in the Adriatic built consistently unk ironclads </s>
<s> During the steam engines improved with the adoption of double expansion steam engines which used less coal than earlier models </s>
<s> The Royal Navy decided to switch to the double expansion engine in and by they were widespread </s>
<s> However this development alone was not enough to herald the end of the mast </s>
<s> Whether this was due to a conservative desire to retain sails or was a rational response to the operational and strategic situation is a matter of debate </s>
<s> A steam only fleet would require a network of coaling stations worldwide which would need to be fortified at great expense to stop them falling into enemy hands </s>
<s> Just as significantly because of unk problems with the technology of the boilers which provided steam for the engines the performance of double expansion engines was rarely as good in practice as it was in theory </s>

<s> Fleets While ironclads spread rapidly in navies worldwide there were few pitched naval battles involving ironclads </s>
<s> Most European nations settled differences on land and the Royal Navy struggled to maintain a deterrent parity with at least France while providing suitable protection to Britain s commerce and colonial outposts worldwide </s>

<s> Little unk poem Little unk is the fourth and final poem of T S Eliot s Four unk a series of poems that discuss time perspective humanity and salvation </s>
<s> It was first published in September after being delayed for over a year because of the air raids on Great Britain during World War II and Eliot s declining health </s>
<s> The title refers to a small Anglican community in unk established by Nicholas unk in the century and scattered during the English Civil War </s>
<s> The poem uses the combined image of fire and unk fire to emphasise the need for purification and unk </s>
<s> According to the poet humanity s flawed understanding of life and turning away from God leads to a cycle of warfare but this can be overcome by unk the lessons of the past </s>
<s> Within the poem the narrator meets a ghost that is a combination of various poets and literary figures </s>
<s> Little unk focuses on the unity of past present and future and claims that understanding this unity is necessary for salvation </s>
<s> Background Following the completion of the third Four unk poem The Dry unk Eliot s health declined and he stayed in unk Green Surrey while he recovered </s>
<s> During this time Eliot started writing Little unk </s>
<s> The first draft was completed in July but he was dissatisfied with it </s>
<s> He believed the problems with the poem lay with his own inability to write and that precipitated by air raids on London he had started the poem with too little preparation and had written it too quickly </s>
<s> After the first draft was written he set the poem aside and he left in September to lecture throughout Great Britain </s>
<s> After months of not working on the poem Eliot began to feel compelled to finish it it was not until August however that he started working on it again </s>
<s> In total there were five drafts </s>
<s> The poem was finished by September and published in the October New English Weekly </s>
<s> Little unk was intended to conclude the Four unk series unk Eliot s views expressed in this series of poems </s>
<s> Little unk was the home of an Anglican community established in unk by Nicholas unk </s>
<s> The unk household lived a Christian life according to High Church principles and the Book of Common Prayer </s>
<s> The religious community was dispersed during the English Civil War between unk and unk but reformed ending with the death of John unk in unk </s>
<s> Eliot had visited the site in May </s>
<s> Unlike the other locations mentioned in the titles of the Four unk poems Eliot had no direct connection to the original Christian community </s>
<s> As such the community is supposed to represent almost any religious community </s>
<s> Poem Critics classify Little unk as a poem of fire with an emphasis on unk and the unk fire </s>
<s> The beginning of the poem discusses time and winter with attention paid to the arrival of summer </s>
<s> The images of snow which provoke desires for a spiritual life transition into an analysis of the four classical elements of fire earth air and water and how fire is the primary element of the four </s>
<s> Following this is a discussion on death and destruction things unk and regret for past events </s>
